commit_message: Tweak params for alignment related tasks
Updated SPAN to the last release 2.0.6558

* Added rules graph
* Prepare for SPAN 2.0
Fix prohibited params usage in resources section
Use --bw to produce coverage bigwig files
When matching treatment and control we want the avangard matches to be more important
Updated SPAN version to 1.4.6197 with fixed --threads parameter support
Explicitly check presence of output files, otherwise missing intermediate tmp files are causing even existing files re-computations
Force MACS2 to use BAM format to make it process BAMs converted from BED files.
Override bams from fastq generation if start_with_bams option is enabled
Don't add None control to map
Fixed control presence check for SICER
No control matching for ATAC-seq required
Make NRF and PBC computation for BAM files optional
Revert bowtie wrapper to 0.36.0 because of bowtie2 error 141

Updated pipeline:
* Updated tools versions
* Added option to start with BAM files
* Reworked README
Option start_with_bams to launch peak calling or visualization for existing BAM files.
Removed deduplicated reads step as useless, cleanup
Improve control detection by taking into account chunks of names
Split alignment and qc into different rules
Don't call peaks for control files
Added references to tools to readme
Updated SPAN for version 1.0-5598, tweaked SPAN defaults
Sufficient RAM for index building and tweaked threads
Cleanup tmp folder usage for SICER
Fixed SPAN rule to use assigned RAM, removed span semi-supervised peak calling
Fixed SICER step problem with temporary folder
Cleanup technical pipeline - BAM deduplication rules
Update for previous commit - fix conda channel
Restructured utility functions, added support to force single end analysis

Updated pipeline:
* More flexible paired end samples naming
* Options to turn macs / sicer / span on or off
Added span_iterations parameter to config.yaml and tweaked default SPAN params
Fix tbb version, since bowtie requires it for correct work
Create empty file in MACS2 if MACS2 failed to build model
Resources section for bowtie index building
Fixed usage of different folders for parallel SICER processing
Use worflow.basedir Snakemake variable instead of manually configuration of pipeline folder
Fix DAG slow creation. Save slow disk-related operations to variables.

run pipeline from any working directory: pass custom working directory using '--directory <work_dir>' snakemake option, pass pipeline source directory using '--config pipeline_src_path=<pipeline_src_dir>' if it differs from current directory. Config file should exist in working directory <work_dir>/config.yaml
The less wildcards the better, fix circular dependency

Fixed snap rules:
* pass control args correctly
* don't make model as output, otherwise it get removed when calling peaks with different settings
1) rules renamed 2) bugs in env paths and filtering input fixed
1) rules moved to `rules`, scripts to `scripts` according to snakemake conventions 2) minor bugs fixed in logging 3)
cleanup, always used *.fq.gz for trimmed reads
cleanup + pipeline refactored, single-end trimmed reads processing fixed

1) phantom metrics fixed 2) defaults moved to config, overwrite other settings via `snakemake --config key=value` 3) environment.yaml for snakemake installation added 4) input support for macs2/sicer/span 5) annotations matching for span tuning 6) support both fastq and gzipped fastq as input 7) readme updated 8) bam alignment and stats rules cleanup 9) pipeline split in simple steps 10) trimming step is optional 10) bam metrics step is optional
Fix launching SPAN in qsub env, memory settings should be mentioned as resources explicitly

Extracted python code to pipeline_util.py
Updated pipeline to support input for peak calling
Correct filtration for single end reads
Correct arguments for single end alignment + use lambda in params.
Make Trim Galore detect adapters automatically + fix single end alignment

1. os.path.join cannot deal with CommandOutput, explicit conversion
2. bowtie2 wrapper requires input.sample
Fixed bowtie2 index and bam filter
Fixed conda env to include bowtie2
Switched to bowtie2 and --dovetail option for ATAC-Seq data
Use trim-galore for nextera adapters trimming, since cutadapt produces imbalanced fastq files with --paired option.

* Support qsub cluster scheduler system
* Added cutadapt step
Code for tuning SPAN models given markup
Fixed empty logs problems and added SPAN parameters
Fixed SICER to use different temp folders
Updated Snakemake file to use conda and wrappers for some tasks.
